Content:
The Mac Catalyst Recipe app is just weird to me https://developer.apple.com/tutorials/mac-catalyst

The sample image shows the macOS and iPad images. But the default Interface in Xcode is "Scaled to Match iPad", which shows the side bar. "Optimized for Mac" shows the iPad interface.

What?

Content:
@pedrojesus IMO that's part of it. There's only one full time docs writer, and their focus is on MAUI. The SDKs docs won't be done unless the team themselves do it, and they're overbooked as is.

Which then creates the problem for people trying to build or port libraries to MAUI, since that requires knowing the SDKs (How to bind, etc.), which are not being documented now.

Account.Note: Senior Dev for VS UI Tools in DevDiv at Microsoft, prev. Xamarin. App developer. Open Source stuff. Archiver. I make bits move on the WWW, and also Gopher. 英語と日本語でツイットしていますよ。

Fields.Name: Website
Fields.Value: https://drasticactions.dev

Fields.Name: GitHub
Fields.Value: https://github.com/drasticactions

Content:
A slightly annoying aspect to newer Apple bindings for .NET is how they tie themselves to MAUI and only support the platforms it supports, https://github.com/roubachof/Maui.Nuke/blob/main/Maui.Nuke/Maui.Nuke.csproj#L4

Nuke supports iOS, Catalyst, macOS and tvOS. This only supports iOS and Catalyst, I assume to support MAUI (The UI Framework), when it _could_ be used for more.

https://github.com/drasticactions/Drastic.PureLayout/blob/main/src/Drastic.PureLayout/Drastic.PureLayout.csproj#L4

With a little more plumbing, I can support them all.

Card.Description: Maui version of the Nuke iOS image caching native library - Maui.Nuke/Maui.Nuke.csproj at main · roubachof/Maui.Nuke

Content:
Takes all of about 5 minutes to see that they are linking iCloud IDs to... what's sent to the App Store. Which, no shit, you're signed into it.

Also, writing a story about a random tweet and not asking actual developers what it could mean. Great stuff all around.

https://www.theverge.com/2022/11/21/23471827/apple-app-store-data-collection-analytics-personal-info-privacy

Card.Title: iOS developers say Apple’s App Store analytics aren’t anonymous
Card.Description: According to Mysk, Apple can link data it collects with your Apple ID, even if you have device analytics collection off. It’s a reminder about the difference between Apple’s privacy marketing and policies.
